file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-20-04-04 - NOSE LANDING GEAR SPRING CARTRIDGE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOSE LANDING GEAR SPRING CARTRIDGE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the spring assemblies of the nose landing gear. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY SPRING ASSEMBLIES OF THE NOSE ALL 32-20-04-000-801-A LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL SPRING ASSEMBLIES OF THE NOSE ALL 32-20-04-400-801-A LANDING GEAR - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-20-04 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-20-04-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SPRING ASSEMBLIES OF THE NOSE LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the spring assemblies of the nose landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY GSE 097 Tool, Spring Mounting To Remove the Spring E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nose landing gear I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) For aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system No. 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (2) For aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, install the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-20-04 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker, and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (4) Make sure that the safety pins of the landing gears are installed ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). (5) Make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released. (6) Install spring mounting tool GSE 097 to the springs. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: MAKE SURE THAT SPRING MOUNTING TOOL GSE 097 IS CORRECTLY ATTACHED TO THE SPRINGS BEFORE YOU REMOVE THEIR ATTACHING ELEMENTS. (1) Remove the cotter pins (1) and (12), nuts (2) and (13), and washers (3) and (14). (2) Remove the cotter pin (5), nut (6), washers (7) and (9), bolt (10), and spacer (8). (3) Remove the spring assemblies (4) and (11). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-20-04 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Spring Assemblies of the Nose Landing Gear - Removal/Installation Figure 401 AUXILIARY BRACE STRUT B SPRING ASSEMBLIES NLG LEG A ZONE DET. A 711 11. SPRING AUXILIARY ASSEMBLY BRACE 10. BOLT 12. COTTERPIN STRUT 13. NUT 14. WASHER 9. WASHER 8. SPACER 1. COTTERPIN DET. B 7. WASHER 1 6. NUT STRUCTURE 2 2. NUT (NOSE FUSELAGE) 5. COTTERPIN 3. WASHER 1 4. SPRING TORQUE: 1.47 TO 1.98 N.m (13 TO 17.5 lb.in) ASSEMBLY 2 TORQUE: 3 TO 4 N.m (26 TO 35 lb.in) 145AMM320127.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-20-04 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-20-04-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. SPRING ASSEMBLIES OF THE NOSE LANDING GEAR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the spring assemblies of the nose landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL MS24665-153 - SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY GSE 097 Tool, Spring Mounting NLG/MLG To Install the Spring E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Cotter pin MS24665-153 3 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nose landing gear I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install spring mounting tool GSE 097 to the spring assemblies (4) and (11). (2) Put the spring assemblies (4) and (11) in their installation position between the auxiliary brace strut and the support at the aircraft structure. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-20-04 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Install the washers (3) and (14) and nuts (2) and (13). Torque to 3 to 4 N.m (26 to 35 lb.in). (4) Install the spacer (8), bolt (10), washers (7) and (9), and nut (6). Torque to 1.47 to 1.98 N.m (13 to 17.5 lb.in). (5) Install the cotter pins (1), (5), and (12). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove spring mounting tool GSE 097. (2) On the circuit breaker panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (3) For aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, remove the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-20-04 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
